CatDescriptText: Mrs. Cleo Keith, beautician, Schenley Heights and Miss Kathleen Holloway, Schenley Heights, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 1, 1961, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think ethnic groups (like the Negro people) profit more by voting a straight party ticket, or are there better advantages for them in splitting a ticket?" Mrs. Cleo Keith's answer reads: "If the Negro vote knows who's running, it should split the ticket and vote for the best man."   Miss Kathleen Holloway's answer reads: "The better advantages come when the voters split the ticket..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Cleo Keith wearing blouse with covered buttons and eyeglasses, standing in front of building; Portrait of Kathleen Holloway wearing light colored coat, standing in front of store window and back facing man
